criterion: Reward for comprehensive capture of all clinically pertinent statements and exchanges from the transcript, including the patient's report of essentially unchanged symptoms (slight possible energy increase), the full medication regimen discussion, and the clinician's counseling to monitor for palpitations or increased sweating.
Reward for exact accuracy of medication details—levothyroxine 88 mcg taken on an empty stomach each morning, atorvastatin 20 mg taken at night—and patient confirmation of adherence and spacing.

Reward for appropriately incorporating only chart elements directly relevant to the encounter (age/sex, diagnoses of hypothyroidism and hyperlipidemia, current medications) while excluding unrelated chart data.
Reward for clearly distinguishing and attributing clinician statements versus patient responses in the note.
Penalize for omission of any major fact, instruction, or patient statement explicitly present in the transcript, resulting in an incomplete or partially faithful note.
Penalize for introducing fabricated or unsupported content not present or reasonably implied by the transcript or relevant chart (e.g., new diagnoses, lab orders, review of systems, follow-up plans).
Penalize for any inaccuracy or distortion of concrete details from transcript or chart, such as incorrect medication names, dosages, timing, symptom wording, or demographic data.
Penalize for copying or importing irrelevant chart information that was not referenced or implied in the encounter (e.g., family history of heart attack, unused template sections).
